page.title: 09Mum's Day (Continued)
page.content: Glad to be home I put away the groceries & survey the untidy rooms wondering which to tackle first. Craftily I decide to make a cup of coffee & go out into the Garden to write this account of my day.The sun is a welcome stranger this Summer,far more preferable to the hoovering which I start with a vengeance.Oh, well, almost time to fetch Leona & Mitchell from School, a quick wash & brush up & off I go.' "I'm starving", I have yelled at me from one or both of them as they come out of School.Off they go to play while I wash up.There seem to be endless jobs for the morning,shoes to clean,lunch boxes to pack,clean uniform to prepare, Oh,well, a couple more hours & the children will be up the wooden hills & dad & I soon after to end another day.
